pr_title: UCTE: quality of datasets and calculations support

timeline.author: benrejebmoh

timeline.bodyText: This log doesn't give enough information: If plenty of my buses have a bad nominalVoltage, I won't be able to find which one. You have to add contextual information in the log such as the busId, the nominal voltage, the lower et upper bound.
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: Do not use magic numbers in the code: use constant instead that could be easily change to update the whole code
timeline.author: mathbagu
mathbagu
mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: I would call the check inside the line.fix() method.
timeline.author: mathbagu
mathbagu
mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: From my point of view it's strange to have two different classes for UCTE validation. I'm pretty sure you can implement all the checks directly on the UCTE model
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: I have removed the check made on buses because if has to be done after a power flow calculation and so at another level than the import and the export. But for targetV checks (generators and transformers), it is really easier to make them on IIDM. On UCTE model, it is not easy to retrieve the voltage level from the generator and the regulating terminal of a transformer. Is it really an issue?
replies.author: annetill

replies.bodyText: I have now totally removed the checks done on IIDM model. I have the impression that the checks on UCTE model are not done just before the export IIDM to UCTE, it is right or I am mistaken ?
replies.author: annetill

timeline.bodyText: You have to do something in the default: in that specific case, throw an assertion error because we don't expect another line.status value.
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: All these logs don't give enough contextual information
timeline.author: mathbagu
mathbagu
mathbagu
